snippet.title: Gamification Panel Discussion // hosted by Nokia (EN) - Social Media Week Berlin 2011
snippet.description:
Gamification Panel Discussion // hosted by Nokia (EN) - Social Media Week Berlin 2011
Toegevoegd door SMWBerlin laatste september
Following Gabe’s keynote we had a panel discussion with Sina Kamala Kaufmann from wooga who responded to his ideas, and add some thoughts of her own. Sina is the head of communications and partnerships at wooga (world of gaming), the second largest developer of social games worldwide.Then, Willempje Vrins took us on the journey of designing, developing and promoting a new sport that motivates people to work out in a new way, by using game mechanics and principles. That sport is called Figurerunning.
30 views

snippet.title: Discussion with Joel Comm - Social Media Fizzle - iPad ...
snippet.description:
Discussion with Joel Comm - Social Media Fizzle - iPad ...
Toegevoegd door whiteplasticbag 4 jaren geleden
http://www.MarketingProfessor.com Discussion with Joel Comm at a recent social media social event in northern Colorado. With marquee names in the internet marketing industry deleting their twitter (and other) accounts, where are people going wrong with Social Media? Joel's company created the iFart iPod applicatin, and shares his impressions of the iPad thus far. Kindle is dead. Make Your Thoughts Known! Please: 1.) Leave a comment 2.) Like (if you do) 3.) Save to Favs 4.) Subscribe to the channel (if you haven't already)
12 views

snippet.title: Social Discussions Plugin Setup
snippet.description:
Social Discussions Plugin Setup
Toegevoegd door Blog Success 2 jaren geleden
http://www.blogsuccess.com/gopremium Time and Confusion: The two biggest hurdles members frequently run into are having enough time to get everything done with their blogs and being confused about what their site should look like and do when people land on it.The second point, confusion, is often related to the first point, time. If you don't take the time to work through the material here, you can miss key steps in building a a great, professional-looking and performing site.So make sure you spend your time wisely and work through the training system the way it is laid out - it will end up SAVING you a lot of time! http://www.blogsuccess.com/gopremium
